pros: It’s better than the alternatives in town!
cons: A bit corporate being under UHS, but leadership is supportive.

pros: Culture of cooperation between interdisciplinary team members
Everyone is friendly. Management shows they care
cons: Still getting the hang of things since it's a newer hospital.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Sparks, NV
pros: Staff was great team to work with great small town feel!
cons: Pay was significantly less than what I made in California
Hiccups with opening a new hospital, as can be expected

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Reno, NV
pros: Great facility, CEO is an amazing human. They seem to be trying to give a crap about their nurses.
cons: Still a corporate hospital, with corporate micromanagement.

pros: Cool CEO, he comes around often.
cons: No education department for nurses. Felt pretty messy with throughput. Lots of safety concerns. Short staffed everywhere. Benefits suck.

pros: Northern Nevada Medical Group has gone through management changes in the recent years. The new management team has done an excellent job at changing the culture and focusing heavily on providing the best patient care, while still taking into account feedback from staff. There is definitely lots of work! Especially with all of the recent growth and growth to come in the near future. My time at Northern Nevada I felt a strong sense of mission and purpose. Lots of fun events monthly, contests, teambuilding events employee of the quarter awards to thank staff. Management team is very approachable and willing to listen to concerns and is highly collaborative.
cons: None that I can think of!

pros: Staff throughout the hospital are friendly and supportive of one another.
cons: Management in my department needed improvement but because there were too many employees they had to manage.

pros: My immediate supervisor was wonderful but the person she worked under was terrible.
cons: Salary was terrible, the amount of work expected from you was unrealistic to get done by one person and promises were not kept.

pros: Administration is there for staff and stand behind them with patient and family issues
cons: Same as any hospital... Often short staffed

job_title: IT Support Technician in Sparks, NV
pros:
- Competitive Pay
- Good health insurance
- Overall decent enough culture
- Acceptable work/life balance
cons:
- Zero advancement opportunity in IT department
- Doctors are extremely rude no matter what, even though you're only trying to help them
- Being on call is terrible
- Pay tops out very quickly and you only get about a .25 cent raise per year after that
- Very busy, so little to no time for cross training, which creates skill vacuums whenever someone is sick or on vacation
- You get a lot of PTO, but, you do NOT get paid holidays, so you have to use PTO for each holiday. Also, it's a hospital and you will get sick, A LOT, so there's goes another big chunk of your PTO.

pros: Worked with my schedule, paid fair
cons: Within 2 weeks of working there I was accused of stealing narcotics by the pharmacy director because the pixus moved extremely slow and didn’t process my drug delivery count correctly. I immediately had 2 pharmacists verify that it was a pixus error but I was still called on my day off and told that I was a liar. I quit immediately because I’m not going to risk being accused wrongly and losing my license.

review_title: Good experience, but not a place to stay.
pros: Nutrition experience in acute care; free food
cons: Poor management, schedules change the week of, overworked and underpaid. Nurses and doctors have no respect for the Dietary crew.
